results.title: News digest [No. 3]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Mechanized hiking in East Gippsland with a four-wheel drive vehicle which “swims” and makes its own road; infested trees are destroyed in the fight against the sirex wasp; business principles are taught and put into practice at Port Albert where children make and sell pottery; divers test their reactions and equipment under ice.

results.title: News digest [No. 2]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Crop-dusting aircraft help growers produce cotton near Robinvale; Dhurringile, a castle near Shepparton, is home to Scottish orphans who learn its history and help on the farm; the “Tambo Lady”, a 65-foot motor cruiser has a test run along the Latrobe River to Sale; young artists’ work displayed at the Museum of Modern Art.

results.title: News digest [No. 12]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Horses and hounds “meet” at Oaklands Hunt Club for fiftieth year; model steam engines run on backyard tracks; Melbourne’s model boat club members control hand-made miniatures by radio; gliders of the Wimmera Soaring Club soar up to 1,100 feet; for the film fan variety is provided by the Echuca Regional Library; Austrian instructors and modern lodges attract many skiers to Falls Creek.

results.title: News digest [No. 11]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Grand parade of steam engines at Echuca veterans rally; instant home on trailer converts into caravan in 3 minutes; Officer cadets from many countries train together at Portsea; walkie-talkie helps annual round-up of cattle in Baama forest; unusual garden hobby of Mildura resident is collecting spiders.

results.title: News digest [No. 10]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: “Look no waves” - ‘surfing’ on skates at Sandringham. “White Harvest” - of 25,000 tons of salt from Lake Tyrrell. “Imitation realist” - exhibition of assemblages by Colin Lanceley, includes “Shoot the Piano Player” and “Reliquary”. Samoyeds’ hair spun with wool and knitted. “Jumping jacks”- at the Victorian Trampolining Championships showing grace and skill.

results.title: News digest [No. 1]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Aerial fire fighters spraying a thin jelly, provide a valuable addition to orthodox methods; underwater divers hunt seals with a camera and shoot them on film; demolition of St. Peter’s church at Eaglehawk; wheelwright at Bridgwater shows his craftsmanship, repairing an iron wheel.

results.title: New tools for learning
results.creator_credit: Bernard Berelson and Audio-Visual Center of University of Chicago
results.brief_description: Shows how the film, together with a wide range of other materials, can bring richness and greater vitality to teaching. Effective methods of classroom use of films are demonstrated through scenes showing pupils and teachers at work in school situation, at junior and senior high school and also university level. The importance of the use of a wide range of instructional materials in the tremendous task of education is stressed.

results.title: New paths to learning
results.creator_credit: Litton Industries Broadcast and Space Age Images
results.brief_description: The electronic age is revolutionising teaching. Oakland Community College in Michigan worked with Litton Industries to develop an automated system to enable a student to take their course at a time convenient to them. The College provides programmed instruction in a variety of subjects for people of all ages over a period of 14 hours each day. An automated cubicle in an audio-tutorial laboratory replaces the usual classroom.

results.title: New man on the land: tomorrows harvest
results.creator_credit: Godfrey Baseley, BMT Visuals and Massey-Ferguson Ltd
results.brief_description: Modern methods of farming have dispensed with much of the toil and drudgery often associated with agricultural labor. Shows the importance of training for young farm-workers, and of the older generation accepting a business-like approach to farm management and the use of modern techniques. What this means in human terms for one group of farmers in Britain is described when the film visits West-hide Farm in Herefordshire.
